intro: Dichaetanthera brevicauda, commonly known as the short-tailed dichaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Dichaetanthera brevicauda is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
